moves.1. Nf3: I've been experimenting with the King's Indian Attack.  I often get interesting positions, although I've occasionally gotten really lousy positions.  Mostly because I don't know what I'm doing yet.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Bg2 Bc5 5. O-O d6 6. e4 Bg4: This was a very aggressive move, but I thought it was a good one.  Black signals their intention not to castle Kingside, but to launch a direct attack on White's Kingside.
moves.8. h4 b5: Now, this didn't make sense to me.  Wouldn't Black want to preserve the Queenside pawn structure for 0-0-0 later?  Or what about some follow-through on the Kingside, like Rg8, Nh7, g5?
moves.9. Bg5: One drawback of h5 is that it allows this pin.  Bg5 also prevents the advance of the g pawn.
moves.9... b4 10. Qd2 O-O: Now, this is surprising.  Black decides to castle Kingside after all.  I guess White's Kingside is just as loose.
moves.11. Qc2 bxc3 12. bxc3: I thought about Nxc3, intending Nd5, but I wasn't keen on allowing Nd4 for Black.  Right now Black's Ns don't have a lot of squares.
moves.12... a5 13. Nbd2 a4 14. Nc4: Getting my N to a better square in the center.
moves.14... Qd7 15. Bxf6: Qd7 changes Black's ability to recapture with the Q after Bxf6.  I figured it was worth trading the B to inflict some pawn damage.
moves.15... gxf6 16. Ne3: This N is headed for d5.
moves.16... Bxe3: Black, wisely I think, prevents Nd5.
moves.17. fxe3 f5: Logical play to eliminate the pawn weakness.
moves.18. exf5 Bxf5 19. Ng5: Since Black's Q is overloaded, this threatens Bxc6 followed by Rxf5.
moves.19... f6 20. Nf3 Ra5: I wasn't sure about the intent of this move.  Black's best target is probably g3.
moves.23. Kh2: Protecting g3.  And once again threatening Bxc6 followed by Rxf5.
moves.23... Be6 24. Rxf6: Snatching a hanging pawn.  This also allows the possibility to double heavy pieces on the f file.  Black's K is now fairly vulnerable.
moves.24... Ne7 25. e4: Preventing Nd5 or Nf5.  Also stops ideas like e4 for Black.
moves.26... Ra6 27. exd5: Winning the d pawn.  The Be6 is pinned against the hanging Ra6.
moves.27... Qd6 28. Rxe6: Black resigned here in view of additional material losses.
